entry.title: License Matrix Grow with SAP
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

As I am new to SAP S/4HANA, I would appreciate your help in understanding the license matrix. Could you kindly share the license matrix screen or relevant details?

Specifically, I would like to know:

Whether the Purchase Requisition form can be accessed using a Core User, Advanced User, or Self-Service User license.

Whether there is any difference in licensing between using the Fiori app and the GUI screen for creating Purchase Requisitions.

Thank you for your support.

Best regards,
Silambu

entry.title: BRF+ S4/HANA 2025 BADI code ABAP for key users
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I'm implementing the SD_APM_SET_APPROVAL_REASON badi.

When implementing the badi, it tells me that the ABAP model for key users should be used.

For this badi, a BRF was implemented as the decision-making model.

My issue is that when I try to execute the BRF within the badi, I get the following message:

The use of Class CL_FDT_FUNCTION_PROCESS is not permitted.

I've searched some forums, but they refer to the CL_FDT_FUNCTION_PROCESS_API.

But it doesn't exist on my system.

I've also tried generating a class that inherits from CL_FDT_FUNCTION_PROCESS, but it's defined as final, so I can't inherit its properties.

Is there any other way to run the BRF from the ABAP code for key users?

entry.title: EDI in S4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi All

IDOCs were used for EDI mapping and communication with Business Partners in S4HANA Private Cloud and older versions of SAP ERP. 

What is the recommended way to map EDIs for S4HANA Public Cloud? Are IDOCs available or can we use APIs for the mapping?

Regards

Lakshmi

entry.title: Tax Only Account Payable Invoice S4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

As I am new to SAP S/4HANA, I would appreciate your guidance in understanding the "Tax Only" option.

While booking an AP invoice, is there any setting where only the tax amount is calculated, without including the line item total. Kindly let us know how to enable this functionality or if any configuration is needed.

Thanks & Regards,

silambu

entry.title: SAP Std API Odata V2 Consumption via Service Consumption Model
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

I am in an "SAP S/4 Private cloud (10/2024) without BTP". Focus is clean core. For a given Standard Odata V2 API ( eg Business Partner A2X) how to consume this API?

1: Typical way through SEGW & Service implementation is discouraged as it does not support cleancore . To keep it simple , I dont want to implement anything in Tier3. 

2: I cannot consume it via Service Consumption model as this supports only V4. Moreover, I dont even the see the option of Odata during Service consumption model generation.  Creating Service Consumption Model | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Project System work in progress accrued income
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are working with a construction industry scenario, where projects typically span over long durations. In such cases, while the customer billing is submitted in the following month, the associated project costs are booked in the current month. Therefore, the system is expected to post accrued income for work completed (WIP) in the current period.

Although we have configured the system as per SAP documentation, we are facing issues with the Project System settlement. The system is currently not posting the accrued income as expected.

We have enclosed all relevant configuration details for your reference. Kindly review and guide us on the necessary corrections.

Your support is sincerely appreciated.

WIP Settlement revenue issue

While executing our settlement on for WIP revenue in CJ88, We obtain the following error.

We have planned the budget for the above-mentioned WBS, recorded the associated costs, and posted the milestone linked to the sales order.

Best regards,
Silambu

entry.title: PP-BOM Direct transfer -Data Migration
entry.content:
Hi ,

I want to know while Using direct Transfer method for PP-BOM in " Migrate your Data app" from SAP ECC to S/4 hana 2023  whether few parameters will migrate or not?

1) BOM with Status 1 to 4

2) BOM usage with 1 ,3 and Custom usage . 

3) BOM ALT alphanumeric No

4) ALTITEM group in BOM item.

5) Purchase details in Non stock item.

If not then what will is provision to migrate these without manual intervention?

RISE with SAP SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Manufacturing

entry.title: KKA2 Result analysis Planned cost Vs Actual Cost
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are working in a construction industry scenario where projects typically span over extended durations. In such cases, project costs are incurred and booked in the current month, while customer billing is usually submitted in the following month. Therefore, the system is expected to calculate and post accrued income (WIP) for the work completed within the current period.

In our case:

  • A sales order is mapped to the WBS element. Sales order value = 12,000

  • Budget cost and cost planning against the WBS is 10000

  • Actual cost posted = 1,500

However, when we execute Result Analysis (T-Code: KKA2), the system shows the planned cost as equal to the actual cost (1,500) instead of reflecting the 10,000 planned value.

Could you please guide us on whether there are any configuration settings or planning methods we need to review to ensure the planned cost is correctly reflected during result analysis?

Appreciate your support in resolving this issue.

 

Thanks & Regards,

silambu

Thanks,

Arindam Sur

entry.title: Internal Reconciliation for BP with Both Customer and Supplier Roles
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

When a Business Partner (BP) is maintained as both a customer and a supplier (vendor) in SAP S/4HANA, we would like to perform internal reconciliation or netting at month-endâ€”not just for payments, but for all open items. The objective is to offset payables against receivables so that the net balance is reflected on a single side (Asset or liability) in the Trial Balance.

Could you please guide us on how to carry out this internal reconciliation process? Any best practices, TCodes, or configuration recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

Best Regards,

silambarasan R

entry.title: How to configure SSO from Salesforce to SAP S/4HANA

I'm currently looking for a way to configure Single Sign-On (SSO) from Salesforce to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud. Unfortunately, I havenâ€™t been able to find any official documentation that directly addresses this specific integration.

The closest reference I found is a guide on configuring SSO from Salesforce to SAP HANA, but not specifically SAP S/4HANA in a private cloud environment.

If anyone has experience with this setup or can point me to relevant documentation or best practices, Iâ€™d greatly appreciate your help.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Change tax classification for substituted material sub-item
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a question, maybe it is standard how it works, but would like to check, is it possible to change the tax classification in the sales order item for a substituted material sub-item, currently for the main item the field is open/editable, but for the sub-item it is not, it is greyed out, so in case the tax classification of the sub-item has to be changed, can this be enabled for entry, are there options to do that?

Thank you!

entry.title: What does <Connectivity Service Unavailable> mean when connecting to a Private Cloud system?
entry.content:
We are currently encountering the error message '<Connectivity/ServiceUnavailable>: No se ha podido obtener el contenido debido a un error interno' when trying to connect our SAP BTP environment to an SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud system. Our setup includes properly configured destinations, as shown in the attached screenshots. However, the content channel creation fails, and we receive the mentioned connectivity error.

We speculate that this might be related to an internal SAP connectivity issue, or perhaps there is something specific we may have overlooked in our configuration.

Could anyone provide guidance on:

  • What specifically triggers the '' error?

  • Common configuration oversights that could lead to this issue?

  • Any steps we could take to verify our connectivity configuration or troubleshoot further?

We appreciate any insights or suggestions!

Thank you!

entry.title: Retention in SD
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I would appreciate your guidance on how to handle the retention cycle in SD.

My client requires a specific percentage to be retained from each billing document, which the customer will settle at a later stage. The requirement is to post the retention amount to the customer account using a Special G/L indicator directly from the SD billing document.

Scenario Overview:

  • The retention amount is determined in the sales order using a dedicated condition type.

  • This value flows into the billing document.

  • The goal is for the system to post the retention amount to a customer line item with a Special G/L indicator during billing itself.

Example:

Document Total: 1000
Less Retention (10%): 100
Subtotal: 900
VAT (5%): 45
Net Payable: 945

Expected Accounting Entry from Billing:

Account Debit Credit

Customer (Normal)1045 
Revenue 1000
VAT 45
Customer â€“ Special G/L (Retention)100 
Customer  100

Issue:

When generating the billing document, the system does not allow posting to a customer account with a Special G/L indicator from SD. Hence, we are unable to split the receivable between the normal and retention portions automatically during billing.

Request:

  • Is it technically feasible to post the retention amount to a Special G/L customer line directly from the SD billing document?

  • If not, what is the best practice or recommended workaround for handling this requirement?

  • Are there any standard enhancements (exits, BADIs, VOFM routines) or post-billing processes to achieve this split posting?

Any suggestions, guidance, or shared experiences would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

Best regards,
Silambarasan R

entry.title: Flexible Workflow: class key attribute is blank when a method is called from a task
entry.content:
Hi community,

I am implementing a custom flexible workflow scenario in S/4HANA 2023.

The scenario references a custom class. The attribute MV_OBJECT_ID is the key.

The CONSTRUCTOR method is defined as follows:
Note: the RAISE EXCEPTION clause was added for testing purposes.


The method UPDATE_APPROVAL_STATUS is called from a workflow activity to update a database table.
The issue is, MV_OBJECT_ID has an initial value when this method is called.

The workflow log shows the key field was set correctly. 

From debugging, I figured out that the FIND_BY LPOR and the CONSTRUCTOR methods were called before the UPDATE_APPROVAL_STATUS, and the key attribute was not passed to the FIND_BY LPOR method. could anyone help identifiying what might be missing in the worklow configuration? 


Task definition:


Activity definition:

Binding info:

entry.title: Does S/4HANA Cloud Private edition support Indonesian language?
entry.content:
Seek expert guidance if S/4HANA Cloud Private edition supports Indonesian language.

Indonesian is listed in https://help.sap.com/doc/392c858a3cc8489d993d1abc060b642c/Cloud/en-US/SAP_Translation_Hub_EN.pdf 

https://dam.sap.com/mac/app/p/pdf/asset/preview/68S9i3C?h=&ltr=a

show that the solution comes with best practices for 64 country/region versions in 39 languages and incorporates best-in-class processes across 25 industries. Checked with AI, got the supported language list as below.

  1. Arabic
  2. Bulgarian
  3. Chinese (Simplified)
  4. Chinese (Traditional)
  5. Croatian
  6. Czech
  7. Danish
  8. Dutch
  9. English
  10. Estonian
  11. Finnish
  12. French
  13. German
  14. Greek
  15. Hebrew
  16. Hungarian
  17. Italian
  18. Japanese
  19. Korean
  20. Latvian
  21. Lithuanian
  22. Malay
  23. Norwegian
  24. Polish
  25. Portuguese (Brazil)
  26. Portuguese (Portugal)
  27. Romanian
  28. Russian
  29. Serbian (Latin)
  30. Slovak
  31. Slovenian
  32. Spanish
  33. Swedish
  34. Thai
  35. Turkish
  36. Ukrainian
  37. Vietnamese
  38. Bahasa Indonesia
  39. Vietnamese
